text: Sure thing! it just popped up again now. Confirmed again that the template in design manager is populated. Right now if I fetch, my local template is overwritten blank. If I upload and/or publish in design manager this doesn't seem to affect anything. So far, I've just been waiting a few hours and coming back to see if the page loads (at some point it does again). Please let me know if I can provide any info
if you visit blog.careswitch.dev, I would expect you to see the same exact blank template (coworkers have confirmed they see the same)
Ok I believe I know what is going on here
Are you using the watch command by any chance?
Yes, I do use the watch command

is anyone getting errors on saving standard partial page templates?  i'm getting this error now... [ERROR] line 0: Template does not include the tag {{ standard_header_includes }}.
[ERROR] line 0: Template does not include the tag {{ standard_footer_includes }}. Needed for HubSpot analytics
i went into the design manager and created an empty new standard partial and it gives me the same error

does it have the following annotation?

```<!--
    templateType: page
    isAvailableForNewContent: false
-->```
`isAvailabelForNewContent: false` is necessary because that indicates that the partial is not intended for creating pages so it doesn't need to have `{{ standard_header_includes }}`
yes... i have about 30 of these pages that have been saving fine for months now, suddenly they all fail.  i went into design manager and created a brand new blank page and it gives me the same error
Strange. Looks like we have an issue on our end.
ok thanks for taking a look at it really appreciate it
